name: sfchronicle
text:
Sonoma County Supervisor Lynda Hopkins has a message for tourists: Please stay home. She noted that an influx of people could prompt more calls for emergency services, overloading first responders who should be focused on battling the fires.

name: sfchronicle
text:
Five men are accused of using a Bay Area tire company to swindle the federal government out of as much as $40 million by shipping boatloads of used tires overseas that were falsely labeled as high-tariff plastics and collecting refunds for the tariffs. 

https://t.co/lNv0szDNLT

name: sfchronicle
text: CORONAVIRUS UPDATES: Alameda County is using 70% of its ICU capacity, including for 69 COVID-positive patients, as of Sunday, the most recent data for which data is available. That is down from 73 COVID-positive patients, and 71% ICU capacity, on Thursday. https://t.co/NwfbES5DoQ
